node.title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
node.locationinfo: Mon Aug 1[return][return]Home Depot Parking Lot (South End near the HD nursery)[return]8:30 am
node.description: This is a nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread. WeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32nd St., 32nd to Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries. From Bread, weÍll take Florida Rd.-15th St. to Rotary Park where weÍll rejoin the Animas Trail and return to Home Depot. WeÍll leave HD promptly at designated start time. Helmets required. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.[return]Ride leader: Helen Root, helen@northandroot.com, 505-320-3441.[return]Co-leader: Hugh Brown, hugh.m.brown2@gmail.com, 970-403-3089.

node.title: Hike to Island & Ice Lakes
node.description: A perennial favorite for the spectacular mountain scenery, beautiful alpine lakes and abundant wild flowers. The loop includes both Island & Ice Lakes.[return]Carpool $6, Limit 15, Dogs OK[return]RSVP Norm Stern 385-8554 normstern@frontier.net

node.title: Little Giant Peak via Little Giant Basin
node.description: Drive up steep jeep road for 3 miles, then hike on trail through Little Giant Basin to ridgeline, continue along ridge to Little Giant Peak (13,416Í). Route includes some off-trail hiking and scrambling. The views are spectacular and wildflowers should be abundant. Moderate pace. Carpool $10, 4WD Lo/HC, Limit 12, Well-behaved dogs and owners OK (dog limit 2).[return]RSVP Lyle Hancock lylehancock@bresnan.net

node.title: WW hike: Hope Lake
node.description: Tricia will again lead this hike. TH is by Trout Lake in the Lizard Head area, about a 2 hour drive, so it will be an all day outing instead of the usual morning. Need high clearance for the last 3 miles. Last year the wildflowers were stunning. Please RSVP and try to arrange your own carpool ahead of time. Carpool $15.[return]Leader: Tricia Bayless 799-4535 tbayless@bresnan.net

node.title: Tennis Clinic
node.description: Tennis clinic for all levels of play. Clinic will be lead by SO! member (and former tennis pro) Art Wahl. Lasts until 11:00 am.[return]Limit 10, no dogs[return]RSVP Betsy Norton 764-4568 betsynorton@mac.com

node.title: Hematite Lake and Tower Mt. (13,552Í)
node.description: Climb to Hematite Lake via a steep but pretty good use trail. Then off-trail up the ridge to Macomber with its spiffy view toward Silverton, down to the saddle between Macomber and Tower and up the final grunt to Tower. Return as we came, or try a loop that would return us to the use trail a ways below Hematite Lake.[return]Carpool $6, Limit 10, Dogs OK[return]RSVP Lynn Coburn 247-0914 harrisoncoburn@gmail.com

node.title: Stand Up Paddle Boarding, Demostration #1
node.description: Try the fast-growing sport of stand up paddle boarding on calm, warm Turtle Lake. We'll try several boards with two instructors. Cost $30. 4CRS's cancellation/refund policies apply.[return]Register through Four Corners Riversports, 970-259-3893 and confirm with Mary.[return]RSVP: Mary Gillam at 970-259-0966 or gillam@rmi.net

node.title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
node.locationinfo: Mon Aug 8[return][return]Home Depot Parking Lot (South End near the HD nursery)[return]8:30 am
node.description: This is a nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread. WeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32nd St., 32nd to Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries. From Bread, weÍll take Florida Rd.-15th St. to Rotary Park where weÍll rejoin the Animas Trail and return to Home Depot. WeÍll leave HD promptly at designated start time. Helmets required. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.[return]Ride leader: Helen Root, helen@northandroot.com, 505-320-3441.[return]Co-leader: Hugh Brown, hugh.m.brown2@gmail.com, 970-403-3089.

node.title: Little Molas/Colorado Trail
node.description: Hike to a lovely red rock waterfall. Beautiful vistas and flowers. Early turn backs with a buddy ok.[return]Carpool $5, Limit 12, 2 well behaved dogs ok.[return]RSVP Susan Beck-Brown 970-375-0948 sbeckbrown@yahoo.com

node.title: SO! Monthly Meeting
node.description: [return][return]What's Happening to Our Weather; Effects on Hiking Safety in SW CO[return]Bob Thompson, a favorite of SO members, will present photos and facts.[return]

node.title: WW hike: Spud Lake
node.description: The hike passes through aspen and along several interesting beaver ponds, some of which are still active. From the lake are views of the Twilight Peaks and Engineer Mountain. We will hike up to the lake, around its circumference, and back.[return]Dogs on leash only. RSVP non-members and those meeting at TC and DMR. Carpool $5[return]Leader: Eric Pahlke 247-1130 pahlkee@aol.com

node.title: Crater Lake Trail
node.description: Long hike, spectacular views; into Weminuche Wilderness; 6-8 hours; 15 people max, Carpool $5,No Dogs. [return]RSVP Steve Krest 970-588-3806 skrest@earthlink.net

node.title: San Luis Peak (14,014), Organ Mountain (13,801), Creede Repertory Theatre
node.locationinfo: Fri Aug 12[return]Sun Aug 14[return][return][return][return]Sat Aug 13[return]Creede 6:00 am[return]Meeting Place TBD[return][return]Sun Aug 14[return]Creede 5:30 am[return]Meeting Place TBD
node.description: Friday, August 12: Meet in Creede, Colorado for pre-post theatre pot-luck. Pot luck at space 208, Mountain View RV Park. Matinee at 1:30p.m. or evening show at 7:30. Creederep.org for tickets. No limit . [return][return] Climb Organ Mountain: Exploratory hike through seldom visited valley. Grassy slopes, wildlife, creeks and views of the La Garitas.[return]Limit 10, NO dogs, Fast pace.[return]RSVP Carolyn Wilber 799-1426 car123lyn@gmail.com[return]Co-leader Bill Zimsky[return][return]Climb San Luis Peak: Least climbed of the 14Íers. West Willow Creek TH. Route mostly above tree line. Vistas, wildlife, flowers and seclusion. Weather determining factor for success due to high altitude exposure.[return]Limit 10, NO dogs, Fast pace.[return]RSVP Carolyn Wilber 799-1426 car123lyn@gmail.com[return]Co-leader Bill Zimsky

node.title: Highland Mary Lakes/Continental Divide Trail Loop
node.description: A rewarding and scenic hike past alpine lakes, through a high tundra basin, on a trail with spectacular valley and mountain views. Lots of waterfalls.[return]Carpool $10, 4WD/HC, Limit 15, Dogs OK[return]RSVP Terri Wells 259-0728 terriwells7@hotmail.com

node.title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
node.locationinfo: Mon Aug 15[return][return]Home Depot Parking Lot (South End near the HD nursery)[return]8:30 am
node.description: This is a nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread. WeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32nd St., 32nd to Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.[return]Ride leader: Helen Root, helen@northandroot.com, 505-320-3441.[return]Co-leader: Hugh Brown, hugh.m.brown2@gmail.com, 970-403-3089.

node.title: WW hike: Colorado Trail 2nd TH to Gudy's Rest
node.description: From the upper trailhead, the hike begins with a gradual but steady uphill and follows along the creek from above through the canyon. The trail then descends slightly arriving at a bridge after 1.5 miles. Once at the bridge, there are a series of reasonable, comfortable switchbacks for approximately 1.4 miles to GudyÍs Rest. The return is along the same route.[return]No Dogs. SO members only.[return]Leader: Barb Hancock 764-4531 hancockbarbs@gmail.com

node.title: Stand Up Paddle Boarding, Demonstration #2
node.description: Try the fast-growing sport of stand up paddle boarding on calm, warm Turtle Lake. We'll try several boards with two instructors. Cost $30. 4CRS's cancellation/refund policies apply.[return]Register through Four Corners Riversports, 970-259-3893 and confirm with Mary.[return]RSVP: Mary Gillam at 970-259-0966 or gillam@rmi.net

node.title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
node.locationinfo: Mon Aug 22+F24[return][return]Home Depot Parking Lot (South End near the HD nursery)[return]8:30 am
node.description: This is a nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread. WeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32nd St., 32nd to Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.[return]Ride leader: Helen Root, helen@northandroot.com, 505-320-3441.[return]Co-leader: Hugh Brown, hugh.m.brown2@gmail.com, 970-403-3089.

node.title: Relay Creek/Greyrock Ridge Loop
node.description: Hike up old logging roads to fantastic views, then return via different logging roads through lovely forests.[return]Carpool $5. Limit 12, 2 well behaved dogs ok..[return]RSVP Susan Beck-Brown 970- 375-0948 sbeckbrown@yahoo.com

node.title: AH Wilderness Camp via Tacoma Power Plant
node.description: AH Wilderness Camp via TACOMA POWER PLANT: Start at Haviland Lake, return to Hotter Lake on US 550 (shuttle). Approx. 6 hours. Return to Durango by 4 pm. Carpool $3 , well behaved dogs OK in your own car.[return]RSVP Kathy Schuetz 970-769-3009 krschuetz@gmail.com [return]Co-Leaders Ted Keller and Trish Szekely

node.title: WW hike: Jones Creek
node.description: From the trailhead, the hike climbs consistently uphill through ponderosa pine, spruce, and fir. Returning along the same route. RSVP non -members only. [return]Leader: Shelley Leader 259-9896 shelley.leader@gmail.com

node.title: Colorado Trail Backpack _ Spring Creek Pass to Stony Pass
node.locationinfo: Fri Aug 26[return]Mon Aug 29[return][return]Meeting time and place to be determined
node.description: Backpack segments 22 and 23 of the Colorado Trail from Spring Creek Pass (south of Lake City) to Stony Pass. We will experience some of the most remote and high elevation areas of the Colorado Trail. Day 1: Drive to Spring Creek Pass, hike 5 miles to campsite (1300Í) . Day 2: Hike 8 miles to Ruby Creek (1400Í). Day 3: Hike 12 miles to Cataract Lake (2800Í). Day 4: Hike 11 miles to shuttle vehicles at Stony Pass (2800Í). Dogs OK. 4WD not required, but we will need help placing 4WD/HC shuttle vehicles at Stony Pass. Carpool to be determined by carpoolers. Limit 10. [return]RSVP Joline Morrison, 970-884-2572 or morrisjp@uwec.edu, or Mike Morrison, morriscm@uwec.edu

node.title: Hike to the Old Hundred Boarding House
node.description: This spectacular old minersÍ boarding house is perched on the side of Galena Mountain. It was recently restored as an historic landmark.æ The trail is loose and/or steep in places but not long and affords great views.æ We will do it at a moderate pace.æ The final (optional) scramble from the trail down to the boarding house is narrow, steep, and loose with some exposure but is well worth it. Poles helpful.æ 4WD/HC necessary.æ Carpool $11.æ No dogs to the boarding house.[return]RSVP: Clark Lagow 259-9337 or clagow@rmi.net
node.difficultyinfo: Moderate[return]4 miles[return]1000Í[return]Hard for scramble to boarding house

node.locationinfo: Mon Aug 29[return][return]Home Depot Parking Lot (South End near the HD nursery)[return]8:30 am

Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.[return]Ride leader: Helen Root, helen@northandroot.com, 505-320-3441.[return]Co-leader: Hugh Brown, hugh.m.brown2@gmail.com, 970-403-3089.

node.title: Cascade Village to the waterfall
node.description: Starting at Cascade VillageÍs water tanks, hike through dense forest to a spectacular waterfall. Early turn backs with a buddy ok. Carpool $3, Limit 12, 2 well behaved dogs ok.[return]RSVP Susan Beck-Brown 970-375-0948 sbeckbrown@yahoo.com

node.title: WW hike: æBig Canyon to Skull Rock
node.description: Big Canyon trailhead parking is next to New Country Toyota (across highway from Wal-Mart).æHike up/back Big Canyon, plus several loop trails including Skull Rock, Sidewinder, Carbon Junction, and South Rim. No dogs RSVP non-members only.[return]Leader:Dale Suran and Dee Rodman 382-9600 lolakrod@aol.com elrebeco@aol.com

node.title: Boulder Gulch Loop (west side)
node.description: Hike up Boulder Gulch out of Silverton. Gain west ridge (exposure here), go over Peak 13,254Í and drop into basin below Storm Peak. Descend to main trail and out. [return]Well-behaved dogs ok only with leader approval (due to exposure)[return]Carpool $6.[return]RSVP Leader Bob Thompson 970-238-1136

node.title: Climb Grizzly Peak (13,378Í)
node.description: Hike to the base of Grizzly Peak to enjoy meadows, lakes and great views. A few stretches of the trail are on shale. We will then begin the climb of Grizzly Peak, which takes us up a steep rocky couloir, and then a ñshort stroll to the topî as Pixler says. The view from the top is spectacular. We may split into two groups with a moderate option to explore the area around the lake, or perhaps hunt for mushrooms. 4WD necessary (12 miles on Cascade Divide Rd). Carpool $10. Dogs Ok to meadow, but not to the peak.[return]RSVP: Clark Lagow 259-9337 or clagow@rmi.net

node.title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
node.locationinfo: Mon Sep 5[return][return]Home Depot Parking Lot (South End near the HD nursery)[return]8:30 am
node.description: This is a nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread. WeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32nd St., 32nd to Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries. From Bread, weÍll take Florida Rd.-15th St. to Rotary Park where weÍll rejoin the Animas Trail and return to Home Depot. WeÍll leave HD promptly at designated start time. Helmets required. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.[return]Ride leader: Helen Root, helen@northandroot.com, 505-320-3441.[return]Co-leader: Hugh Brown, hugh.m.brown2@gmail.com, 970-403-3089.

node.title: Blackhawk Ridge
node.description: Starting at Hotel Draw, hike the Colorado Trail to Blackhawk Ridge. Lovely creeks, forests, & views. Early turn backs with a buddy ok.[return]Carpool $6, 4WD/HC, Limit 12, 2 well behaved dogs ok.[return]RSVP Susan Beck-Brown 970-375-0948 sbeckbrown@yahoo.com

node.title: WW hike: Lower Hermosa Creek
node.description: From the trailhead, the well defined trail remains at approximately the same elevation with some ups and downs and crosses several side streams that are typically dry or flowing slightly. This is an in-and-out trail. Dogs on leash only please.[return]RSVP non-members only.[return]Leader: Bob Schuckhart 970-459-1945 bschuck1@gmail.com

node.title: Climb Vermillion and Fuller (13,894Í)
node.description: We will start from the Clear Lake road shortcut and hike up the Ice Lake Basin trail to Fuller Lake. Then there is a steep talus climb to the saddle between Fuller (13,761) and Vermillion (13,894). To reach Vermillion there is a traverse with some exposure, then a difficult, but short exposed scramble up a loose couloir to the summit. Fuller is an easy walk-up from the saddle. No dogs. 4 WD, HC clearance required, Carpool $6. Limit 10.[return]RSVP Lynn Coburn 247-0914 or harrisoncoburn@gmail.com

node.title: Fall Colors on the Pine River Trail
node.locationinfo: Fri Sep 9[return]ACP 8:10 am[return]Florida Rd Fire Sta 8:30 am[return]Trailhead[return]9:15 am
node.description: Start at Pine River Trailhead (NE side of Vallecito reservoir) and hike 3-3.5 miles up to the river for lunch and return on the same route. This will be at a moderate pace, some might even say leisurely. Well-behaved dogs on leash or under strict voice control OK. [return]Car Pool $4. Limit 15 due to Weminuche wilderness regulations. Trailhead is near Pine River campground on a gravel road (normal clearance cars OK). Fall colors not guaranteed! Optional stop at the Lakehouse afterwards for a well-earned snack.[return]RSVP: Jeri Sampson 720-289-2712 or jeri5416@gmail.com

node.title: Monday Bike Ride for Intermediate Road Cyclists
node.locationinfo: Mon Sep 12[return][return]Home Depot Parking Lot (South End near the HD nursery)[return]8:30 am
node.description: This is a nobody-gets-left-behind, social ride from Home Depot to Bread. WeÍll meet in the south parking lot at Home Depot (by their nursery); ride the Animas River Trail to E. 32nd St., 32nd to Bread where weÍll stop for coffee and pastries. Contact me if you have questions and to be added to an email list so you can be notified of cancellations due to weather, etc.[return]Ride leader: Helen Root, helen@northandroot.com, 505-320-3441.[return]Co-leader: Hugh Brown, hugh.m.brown2@gmail.com, 970-403-3089.

node.title: Spirit Gulch
node.description: Starting at Red Mt. Overlook, hike through Commodore, Spirit, and McIntyre Gulches. Amazing views. Early turn backs with a buddy ok. Short car shuttle. Carpool $7, Limit 12, NO dogs because of shuttle[return]RSVP Susan Beck-Brown 970-375-0948 sbeckbrown@yahoo.com

node.title: SO! General Meeting
node.description: SO! General Meeting[return]Fall Potluck[return]Social: 6:30 pm[return] Potluck: 7:00 pm[return]Bring your own table service and a dish for eight with a serving utensil.[return]A-FæDessert ææG-MæMain Dish N-Ræsalad ææS-ZæMain Dish [return]In addition to your potluck dish please bring non-perishable food donations or a check for the Manna Soup Kitchen.

node.title: WW hike: Chris Park/Miners Trace
node.description: Starting at the TH by the entrance to Chris Park, we will hike a 4 mile loop up the Wagon Trail, then take the Water Dog Trail and Cowboy Cutoff to the Haviland View Trail and then down Miners Trace, passing by the old Elbert Mine before returning to Chris Park. Poles are handy for stream crossings. No dogs. RSVP non-members only. Carpool $4.[return]Leader: Martha Diehl 317-4037 drodiehl@gmail.com

node.title: White Rim Trail Supported Bike Ride
node.locationinfo: Thur Sep 15-[return]Sun Sep 18[return][return]Meeting time and place to be determined
node.description: Ride mountain bikes on the White Rim Trail and backcountry camp in Canyonlands National Park with support vehicles. Day 1: Island in the Sky Visitor Center to Labyrinth, 27 miles. Day 2: Labyrinth to Murphy, 30 miles. Day 3: Murphy to Airport, 30 miles. Day 4: Airport to VisitorÍs Center, 17 miles. Experienced road or mountain bike riders only, mountain bike required. No Dogs. Three support vehicles needed maximum, with 4WD/HC/Low Range. Carpool to be determined by participants. Limit 15.[return]RSVP Joline Morrison, 970-884-2572 or morrisjp@uwec.edu, or Mike Morrison, morriscm@uwec.edu
node.difficultyinfo: Hard[return]104 miles[return]Steep climb out on last day.

node.title: OurayÍs Perimeter Trail
node.description: Moderately strenuous trail providing beautiful views of Ouray and the surrounding peaks. Worth the drive!! Early turn backs with a buddy ok. Carpool $9, Limit 12, NO dogs because of narrow trail and drop offs.[return]RSVP Susan Beck-Brown 970-375-0948 sbeckbrown@yahoo.com
